elements.title: Surinder Singh Bakhshi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Surinder Singh Bakhshi (pictured) led the successful containment of smallpox in the community during Birmingham's smallpox outbreak in 1978?

elements.title: 2022 U.S. Open Cup Final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2022 U.S. Open Cup Final was the first in 14 years to feature a non-Major League Soccer team?

elements.title: Pietro Badoer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pietro Badoer was banished twice, poisoned one of his three wives, but declined an offer for a coup to make him doge?

elements.title: college debates in the United States (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that college debates in the United States were originally conducted entirely in Latin?

elements.title: Betty Tejada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite entering politics as part of a right-wing party, Betty Tejada was later elected president of the Chamber of Deputies as a member of the Movement for Socialism?

elements.title: Five Flower Songs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Britten's Five Flower Songs, part songs composed for a couple's 25th wedding anniversary, premiered at their estate Dartington Hall?

elements.title: Skeeter the unicycling clown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Rain Pryor drew a picture of her friend Skeeter the unicycling clown in school, her teacher said that there were no Black clowns?

elements.title: British logistics in the Western Allied Invasion of Germany (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British logistics in the Western Allied Invasion of Germany involved buffaloes, ducks and weasels?
